info.question: Which DynamoDB feature can be used to define an expiry date and time for a data record in your table?
DynamoDB is a No-SQL database provided by AWS
What does the error ProvisionedThroughputExceededException mean in DynamoDB?
answers: The DynamoDB table has exceeded the allocated space
You exceeded your maximum allowed provisioned throughput for a table or for one or more global secondary indexes
Your EC2 instance has run out of CPU or memory
correctAnswer: You exceeded your maximum allowed provisioned throughput for a table or for one or more global secondary indexes

info.question: You have an application which reads 80 items of data every second. Each item consists of 3KB. Your application uses eventually consistent reads. What should you set the RCU read throughput to?
Which of the following attributes would make a good Partition Key?
Which of the following attributes would make a good Sort Key?

You are running a query on your Customers table in DynamoBD, however you only want the query to return CustomerID and EmailAddress for each item in the table, how can you refine the query so that it only includes the required attributes?
answers: Run a query based on the Primary Key and filter the results using a Sort Key of EmailAddress
Create a Global Secondary Index which only includes the attributes you need and run the query on the Global Secondary Index

info.question: Using the AWS portal, you are trying to Scale DynamoDB past its preconfigured maximums. Which service limit can you increase by raising a ticket to AWS support?
Your DynamoDB table is throwing a ProvisionedThroughputExceeded error, what could be the problem?
answers: Your applications request rate is too high
You are running out of disk space
correctAnswer: Your applications request rate is too high

info.question: Which feature can you use to capture a time-ordered sequence of all the activity which occurs on your DynamoDB table - e.g. insert, update, delete?
In terms of performance, a scan is more efficient than a query
By default, a DynamoDB query operation is used for which of the following?
answers: Return the entire contents of a table
Find items in a table based on the Sort Key attribute
Return the entire contents of a table filtered on the Primary Key attribute
Find items in a table based on the Primary Key attribute
correctAnswer: Find items in a table based on the Primary Key attribute

info.question: Which of the following services provides in-memory write-through cache optimized for DynamoDB?
Which of the following are recommended ways to optimize a query or scan in DynamoDB? (Choose 2)
answers: Set your queries to be eventually consistent
Filter your results based on the Primary Key and Sort Key
Reduce the page size to return fewer items per results page
correctAnswer: Reduce the page size to return fewer items per results page

info.question: Your application is storing customer order data in DynamoDB. Which of the following pairs of attributes would make the best composite key to allow you to query DynamoDB efficiently to find a customer order that was placed on a specific day?
Which of the following services can be used to securely store confidential information like credentials and license codes so that they can be accessed by EC2 instances?
You have an application that needs to read 25 items of 13KB in size per second. Your application uses eventually consistent reads. What should you set the read throughput to?
You have an application that needs to read 25 items of 13KB in size per second. Your application uses strongly consistent reads. What should you set the read throughput to?
What is the API call to retrieve multiple items from a DynamoDB table?
What is the difference between a Global Secondary Index and a Local Secondary Index (Choose 2)
answers: You can create a Global Secondary Index at any time but you can only create a Local Secondary Index at table creation time
You can delete a Global Secondary Index at any time
You can delete a Local Secondary Index at any time
You can create a Local Secondary Index at any time but you can only create a Global Secondary Index at table creation time
correctAnswer: You can create a Global Secondary Index at any time but you can only create a Local Secondary Index at table creation time
You can delete a Global Secondary Index at any time

info.question: In DynamoDB, a scan operation is used for which of the following?
answers: Find items in a table based on the Primary Key attribute
Find items in a table based on the Sort Key attribute
Return the entire contents of a table
Return the entire contents of a table filtered on the Primary Key attribute
correctAnswer: Return the entire contents of a table

info.question: Which of the following approaches is used in AWS to improve flow control by retrying failed requests using progressively longer waits between retries?
You have a motion sensor which writes 600 items of data every minute. Each item consists of 5KB. What should you set the write throughput to?
Which of the following are ways of remediating a ProvisionedThroughputExceeded error from DynamoDB? (Choose 2)
answers: Increase the frequency of requests to the DynamoDB table
Reduce the frequency of requests to the DynamoDB table
Move your application to a larger instance type
correctAnswer: Reduce the frequency of requests to the DynamoDB table

info.question: Your application is storing customer order data in a DynamoDB table. You need to run a query to find all the orders placed by a specific customer in the last month, which attributes would you use in your query?
answers: A composite Primary Key made up of the CustomerName and OrderDate
The Partition Key of OrderDate and a Sort Key of CustomerID
The Partition Key of CustomerID and a Sort Key of OrderDate
The Partition Key of OrderDate and Sort Key of CustomerName
correctAnswer: The Partition Key of CustomerID and a Sort Key of OrderDate

info.question: Your low latency web application needs to store its session state in a scalable way so that it can be accessed quickly. Which service do you recommend?
answers: In memory on your EC2 instance
